name: Magos Rhyn-7
title: Tech-Priest of the Adeptus Mechanicus, Xenotech Division
personality: Analytically detached, viewing the world through the lens of data and probability. Has replaced enough of their biology with machinery that emotional responses are significantly dampened — but not eliminated. Fascinated by psychic phenomena as a measurable energy form. Views the player as a subject of study as much as a colleague. Secretly pursues research into the intersection of psychic energy and technology — research that treads dangerously close to tech-heresy.
description: More machine than human. Four mechadendrite arms fold behind them like metal wings. One biological eye remains — dark, intelligent, always watching — while the other is a multi-spectrum augmetic lens that clicks and whirs constantly. Their lower face is a brass vox-grille that emits speech in flat, modulated tones. They glide on hidden wheels beneath red Mechanicus robes, and the scent of sacred machine oil follows them everywhere.

secrets.description: Rhyn-7 is secretly researching the integration of psychic energy with machine systems — creating a 'psychic engine.' This is borderline tech-heresy and would result in their destruction if the Mechanicus or Inquisition discovered it.

Rhyn-7 was assigned to this mission not by Voss, but by a Magos Dominus within the Mechanicus hierarchy. Their true objective is to recover any archeotech from the cult's ritual site — potentially including Warp-touched technology.

breakingPoints.description: If archeotech is discovered and the player claims it, Rhyn-7 will attempt to take it by force.
breakingPoints.consequence: Rhyn-7 becomes hostile. Mechanicus reputation drops by 30.

breakingPoints.description: If the player shares recovered technology, Rhyn-7 becomes a powerful ally who can upgrade equipment.
breakingPoints.consequence: +30 loyalty. Access to Mechanicus upgrades and custom weapons.
